title: If a parent dies as a resident of CA or TX, can an adult child living in OR be liable for unpaid medical debts?
question: My mother lives in CA (which is a filial obligation state) with my step father. She is retired and has Medicare. Could I really be liable for any unpaid medical (or other) unpaid bills when she passes away. She has lots of health issues, and could leave a large debt.
answers: If your parent died with assets, those assets can be used to pay debts. If there are no assets, the debts will have to be written off. The only way a child would be responsible to personally pay them is if they personally guaranteed them.
Filial obligation state? Where’d you find that gem? There is no such thing. You are not liable for the debts of any decedent (except a spouse.)
